com.rti.dds.example.file
Class FileSegmentPublisher

java.lang.Object
  com.rti.dds.example.file.FileSegmentPublisher
public class FileSegmentPublisher
extends java.lang.Object

FileSegmentPublisher establishes entities required to read, segment and transmit files from the base directory.

In this thread, it sets up the DDS Participant, Publisher, Topic and DataWriter objects. After initialization, the real work is done by two other threads: FileSegmenter reads files from the base directory, splits them into chunks and pushes these chunks to a segment queue. FileSegmentWriteThread pops chunks from the segment queue and sends them to subscribers via DDS.

Constructor Detail

FileSegmentPublisher

protected FileSegmentPublisher()
The FileSegmentPublisher merely starts a thread that monitors the segment queue size. The real working threads get started in main().

Sets up DataWriter QoS, then creates and returns a new DataWriter.

Parameters:
fileSegmentWriteThread - thread that will use this DataWriter to send samples
fileSegmenter - thread that splits files to be passed to WriteThread
publisher - Publisher for this DataWriter
topic - Topic for this DataWriter
